description:
The Google People Services, Operations function is the services and program management group within People Operations that makes HR stuff easy and intuitive for Googlers. Our global team optimizes people processes, from problem definition to execution. We partner with teams across People Operations and in engineering to bring innovation and technology to the way we attract, retain and grow Googlers worldwide. We focus on providing an amazing experience to past, present and future Googlers, and work in Google’s fast-paced environment to deliver 100+ operational services, manage the contingent workforce and implement HR programs across 70+ countries. Regardless of location or level of experience, members of the Operations team have the opportunity to create, develop and implement some of the most complex global operations around the world.

As a Business Operations Analyst, you’ll play an important role in helping our Google People Services Operations team ensure that Googlers and future Googlers have an excellent experience from before they’re hired to their first day on the job and throughout their career in Google. You’ll work in close partnership with Finance and the Google People Services (GPS) Operations team to develop and track business plans to keep the organization’s performance aligned with the operating plan. You will lead action-oriented analyses and provide insights and strategic recommendations to drive operational efficiency. Projects might include developing models for outsourcing, evaluating costs associated with different location strategies, or employee benefits model scenario development and analysis. Above all else, you’ll focus on ensuring that our People Operations organization is well-informed and able to make thoughtful, data-driven decisions.

Great just isn't good enough for our People Operations team (you probably know us better as "Human Resources"). Made up of equal parts HR professionals, former consultants, and analysts, we're the advocates of Google's colorful culture. In People Ops, we "find them, grow them, and keep them". We bring the world's most innovative people to Google and provide the programs that help them thrive. Whether recruiting the next Googler, refining our core programs, developing talent, or simply looking for ways to inject some more fun into the lives of our Googlers, we bring a data-driven approach that is reinventing the human resources field.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • Experience with spreadsheets.

Preferred qualifications:

  • 4 years of relevant work experience in finance/accounting, management consulting, investment banking, or similar environment.
  • Familiarity with PLX, Hyperion financial data systems and proficiency with modeling and presentation software.
  • Team player; willing to help out other team members as necessary while promoting positive morale.
  • Financial modeling skills, understanding trends, developing insights, turning them into strategies with high impact.
  • Excellent communications skills; solutions and client service-oriented, with an emphasis on creativity and diligence.
responsibilities:
• Provide informative insight into forecasting, business planning and analysis, including strategic alternative analyses, to impact decision making and create actionable insights.
  • Support annual business planning cycle and drive visibility into business performance and resource planning decisions at global and regional level.
  • Develop and report on supplier metrics and provide insights based on data-driven analyses.
  • Analyze the monthly spend analysis from Finance and derive insights for an executive audience.
  • Communicate complex spending trends and metrics to both finance and non-finance business partners.
title: Business Operations Analyst, Google People Services
